Recent updates in New York City include a subway stabbing labeled as a hate crime, a cold front affecting weather, a partial building collapse in the Bronx, and significant developments in local governance, including Mayor Mamdani's plans for transportation and housing amidst federal funding cuts for sanctuary cities.

### Risks & Alerts

- Subway stabbing reported on Lex Avenue Line; incident classified as a Jewish hate crime. - Cold front expected to cause significant temperature drop on Staten Island. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- No injuries reported after partial building collapse in the Bronx. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiqgFBVV95cUxOekJDUFE3N2hKcjA5YTF4ODliYnZHNVVQNEtLUGdKS0xxQ0c5T1FmZzQ0ZXRibFA4d3pyNm5aaUtzaVBoQmNsTmgxZ3lOODduX2R4NnIzbnhESi0xYWZwS0pQZU9XWGFSSkJVLVF5MUhMUXZRbXQ3VkNSN2xJY0Vybk02WTZEUDQzeXh2SmI4TllfMXZObGJRbmJrRE5sR3kxa2h6UGNLTmlBZw?oc=5)

### Civics & Politics
